reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer I just want to make it clear that this game is not like bunnyhopping on csgo, css, gmod etc...

To all the people who have said maybe they didn't want mechanics/the game to be the same as bunny hopping in source games"
If they did
date: maybe they shouldn't sell it as "right back to...when hopping
recommended: strafing and sliding were all the rage."\nThey should probably make it quite obvious that they are going to change the mechanics as the mechanics are what make bunnyhopping
hoursPlayed: well bunnyhopping.\nDon't sell your product as something that it isn't I reviewed this product coming off what they have specifically advertised it as a "remastered" "all in one" game made for bunnyhopping (with the inclusion of sliding). If that's not what they were going for
voteText: they should make it much more obvious that it is not
helpfulPercent: instead of literally selling it as it
votesHelpful: I don't want people getting their hopes up and falling in the same trap as I did.\n\nIntro This is coming from a very experienced bunny hopper
votesTotal: thousands of hours actually bunny hopping on source
votesFunny:
csgo and gmod.
Check my youtube if you want proof or whatever.

Firstly
column16: I am giving no credit to the looks of this game visually
column17: it does look very good yes
column18: however it's made in the unreal engine
column19:
pulling off visually appealing games is very simple due to the lighting in the engine and the high resolution textures in the engine already.

Mechanics/Gameplay (most of the review and is very important.)
Map Design
Sound/Options Menu.
Final Thoughts
Mechanics/Gameplay This game is done in a very poor way
column20: let me explain.\nStrafing in the source engine is done by sync
column21: the way that it works in short is if you have a +left (mouse movement to the left tick) along with a +moveleft (left strafe tick) in the air
column22: then you gain speed.\nThis means that as long as you are doing this
column23: you will gain speed and with autohop
column24:
when you land and jump again you will not lose this speed.

This is the core basics to bunnyhopping in any source engine game.
Bunny hop league is made in the unreal engine
column25: and the mechanics are no way like the source engines'.\n\nBunny hop league in its current state
column26: when you strafe in the air while turning your mouse you gain speed
column27: however you dont keep your speed.\nAlso
column28: its not based on sync either
column29: it's literally the further you strafe
column31: so if you wanted to go fast you have to do 180 degree turns just to go fast
column32: and you have to keep up these strafes because you actually lose speed
column33: until you go at the base movement speed.\nThis completely kills the whole point of the game as you aren't able to keep your speed properly
column34: nor does it replicate the original mechanics coming from the source engine.\n\nMy point is
column35: this game is actually awful in terms of making a game to replicate bunnyhop.\nIt doesn't replicate the mechanics
column36:
only the maps which causes an awful experience to old players and new ones.

Map Design *edited*
A basic lesson you learn when remastering or creating a game of another is that you can't change the mechanics of a game
column37: and keep the same map design
column38: or vice versa.\nIt just doesn't work
column39: the maps design doesn't fit with the new mechanics at all.\nDue to the way you get acceleration with the new mechanics there is no way to go fast without it just being a difficult mess with overly wide strafes
column40: you cannot skip blocks either when you go fast because as soon as you stop having big strafes you LOSE SPEED
column41: so you cant actually keep the speed you made which is core to bunnyhopping in the way it is.\n\nSo even if these mechanics were intended to be in the current state that they are
column42: the maps that have been made for them are not appropriate at all
column43: all the block spacing and placements are very strange and force you to have very small strafes
column44: which with the mechanics of the game
column46: so you are either going very slow constantly
column47: or going fast and failing miserably or having a very awkward time doing 180 strafes.\nAdditionaly
column48: the blocks on the maps are almost all the same size all the time
column49: it's almost like you did no research into bhop map making at all
column50: difficulty scales really well with block size and you seemed to have just been blind to it the whole time
column51: and with the mechanics of the game being off
column52: it's really difficult to land on blocks that small.\n\nFinally
column54: on a few of your maps you have areas where you have to travel up a vertical area using jump pads
column55: these are so hard to do as an ex source player due to the mechanics just being so off.\nIn these sections
column56: you need to strafe a lot to keep your speed
column57: this means doing mutiple 360s in the air and turning very fast.\nIn source
column58: doing this action and gaining speed is quite hard to pull off
column59: but once mastered you can control your speed.\nIn BHL
column61: the more you turn in the air
column63: which ends up just making you go stupidly fast and its impossible to control
column64: with the combination of this and the small blocks
column65: these sections are actually hard as ♥♥♥♥
column66: unless you throw all skill out the window and just dont strafe and "W" it
column68:
No sound?
At all?
No sound effects at all?
Even for the menus????"
My exact words
column69: when I booted this game up on my stream.\nI know this is early access
column71: but you shouldn't be allowed to sell a product
column72: and expect things like this to not be critiqued
column74:
you couldn't of just spend a day making placeholder sounds and putting them in before releasing the game?

The menu options is even worse.
You appeal to the competitive bunny hop community with the release of your game
column77: your controls options are completely empty apart from sensitivity
column78: which is a SLIDER.\nPeople want to replicate their controls from the game you are taking from
column80: not an ambiguous slider which doesnt give us any way to see how close/far away we are from the exact sensitivity we have been playing on for years.\nNo movement bind changes too
column81: please put basic expectancies in your game before releasing it as a sold product.\n\nVideo options
column82: got the basics down at least
column85: gamma changes.\n\nFinal ThoughtsThe game has a lot of potential
column88: this could be the game that brings all the bunnyhop community together from csgo
column90: gmod etc... and bring them to one game
column91:
and really iron out all the problems that the source engine has and make bunnyhopping great again"
But this just isn't the way to do it honestly.
You really have to perfect the way that source engine strafing works if you want people to take your game seriously.
The game looks nice and the idea is amazing.
Please research maps
column92: there are so many amazing css maps
column93: just spend an hour or two on gamebanana and check out and playtest maps
column97: get a feel for what high level play looks like
column98: it will help you out so much.\nI want to love this game and I want it to have the potential to bring the bhop community together
column99: but you really have to make some serious improvements
column100: at this point it's not even worth the £2.00 to spend on the game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good idea to bring bunny hopping to a newer engine, but it needs a lot more work one on the strafing and the feel of the game before its fun to play. I don't think it should copy the strafe style from the source engine but rather make something new that still feels very nice to play if not better. imo it would be best to make something that encourages you to strafe smoothly rather than something where you just have to spam strafes in order to go fast.

I would only recommend buying it at this time if you're curious about it and want to support the developer. I'm saying that mainly because of the lack of content, there's only 7 maps in the game right now plus a tutorial map. I think it would be a good idea to allow people to make custom maps and upload them for other people to play, even though the game is no where near to being finished i still think it would be a good idea, because i don't think it would cost much effort to do so and it would make the game a lot more interesting. I wouldn't say its worth buying right now if you're just playing it casually and are not interested in the development of it, but i'm sure it will become a very good game as time goes on.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has so much potiental please please dont mess it up. And i feel you need to like raise the speed cap and add other styles to the game so that a player can learn new styles such as legit/halfsideways etc... I know this is early ascess but you can go many ways with this game i reccomend you go the way that players would want like the way of bhopping in css and csgo. And more maps with less fans would be nice xD. But make some really interersting maps with differnt shapes in the bhop it self. All and all it is a good game hopefully it goes the right direction

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Version 0.2 fixed some issues i've had with the game, but has also created some. One issue I have at the moment is that the ambience only plays when im moving, which is very annoying, and there's no way to turn it off. The bhop feels a bit better in this version. Also why do I slide off the black and white platforms in the pure" map?

Now for how you could probably improve this in the future. I reckon you could probably add something like a level editor so people can create levels to improve the longevity of the game. You could also probably add some form of multiplayer
date: or even just a chatroom function as a big thing that drew me towards bhop was the banter that happens in chat and over mic.\n\nAlso
recommended: why is my fps capped at 60?\n\nEDIT: Another thing that happens a lot is sliding off of platforms or clipping the edges

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

There are weird bugs upon collision with edges of blocks which can lead to sliding, climbing, falling, or coming to a full stop. Also, strafing will sometimes cause you to lose your speed. (Have you ever played source bunnyhop with sv_airaccelerate set lower than 100? it's kind of like that. Crouching is heavily affected too.)

Game runs great on low settings, and has been improving a lot with every update.

I would suggest adding a global leaderboard or something for world records so that we can at least compete for top times. This game has potential, but a lot of things about it are inaccurate to real" bhop. With that said
date: I'll be interested to see how it progresses with new updates. Also maybe a different style for start zone prespeeding.\n\nI will update/rewrite this review as the game itself updates"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been into BHopping since last June on CS:GO, and when I first heard about this game, I got excited. Now, I have to remember that it's early access.
There's two cons about this game:
-Doesn't have keybind, but was told it's coming
-Doesn't have velocity displaying, would be wonderful.

However, if you like to BHop, like I do, I recommend getting this game and to support the developer.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Bunny Hop League. Find out what is the madness.
*For this review I am grateful to the developer, which has provided the key of the game. However, this had no effect on my professional opinion.

Tell me, are you oldschool player? Can you remember Quake, levels of bunny hopping" and
the feeling of loss to the bots on Nightmare difficulty? All of that is here. Except for bots. And guns.

But the developers from PolyDigital gave us an opportunity to remember those times when we tried to break the record for "bunny hopping" in the distance and minimum time spent. And with this - to remember the feeling of despair and madness of failures and immense happiness upon completion.

The project itself is a set of rooms
date: the passage of which boils down to one - special jumping across the platforms. For beginners there is a training room
recommended: which will show the basic movements.\n\nConsidering that at the moment of writing version is 0.1.1
hoursPlayed: and the game is still in the "early access"
voteText: I can only note that the graphic component is decent
helpfulPercent: though not without problems. But with the sound is a more serious problem - it does not exist
votesHelpful: except for the end of the level. But looking back on the game version - it could be forgiven
votesTotal:
and there is hope for further development.

Finally it should be said about the complexity. I was not able to pass through a training level. The game is really hardcore and for some it will be test not to throw it into the far corner. The game is worth to learn these movements and go through another block. It is worth the broken into the wall mouses. Just try it.

More reviews in our curator group: Dreams of Genesis"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is not a review, this is my suggestions to developer

I have no idea how unreal engine works but at the games current stage your settings seem a bit off. Using source engines values, sv_accelerate and sv_airaccelerate are way too high in this game compared to any bhop server I've been in. If I strafe slowly I barely gain any speed but if I do an instant 180 I gain a ton of speed which shouldn't be the case. Also when not hopping I can prestrafe a lot of speed which shouldn't be possible with correct settings.

Graphichs are nice and shiny, and I assume you'll be adding leaderboards/servers in later stage of development.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI know i voted down for this game, but all it needs is some improvements for me to change my vote from a down to an up. First of all, the motion blur. There needs to be options to make the motion blur go away, because it creates lag for those who dont have good computers. Second, strafing in the game feels off. It just feels slow. Plus there needs to be options to change the key binds for the game. (i did see something about this inside the game in options, which i think means that they will make options for this available in the future but it needs to be addressed.) And the crouching is a little strange as well. All in all the game isnt bad, just needs a few tweaks and it should be good.
